item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I ask you to pass through life at my side—to be my second self, and best earthly companion." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "I have for the first time found what I can truly love–I have found you. You are my sympathy–my better self–my good angel–I am bound to you with a strong attachment. I think you good, gifted, lovely: a fervent, a solemn passion is conceived in my heart; it leans to you, draws you to my centre and spring of life, wrap my existence about you–and, kindling in pure, powerful flame, fuses you and me in one." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "If all the world hated you and believed you wicked, while your own conscience approved of you and absolved you from guilt, you would not be without friends." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Reader, I married him." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I can live alone, if self-respect, and circumstances require me so to do. I need not sell my soul to buy bliss. I have an inward treasure born with me, which can keep me alive if all extraneous delights should be withheld, or offered only at a price I cannot afford to give." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I had not intended to love him; the reader knows I had wrought hard to extirpate from my soul the germs of love there detected; and now, at the first renewed view of him, they spontaneously revived, great and strong! He made me love him without looking at me." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Every atom of your flesh is as dear to me as my own: in pain and sickness it would still be dear." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am not an angel,' I asserted; 'and I will not be one till I die: I will be myself. Mr. Rochester, you must neither expect nor exact anything celestial of me - for you will not get it, any more than I shall get it of you: which I do not at all anticipate." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Conventionality is not morality." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description:
"I must, then, repeat continually that we are forever sundered - and yet, while I breathe and think, I must love him.'
- Jane Eyre" -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Choosers will be beggars if the begging's not their choosing." -- Garth Nix

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Does the walker choose the path, or the path the walker?" -- Garth Nix

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Please," said Lirael..."I think I would like to work in this Library." "The Library," repeated Sanar, looking troubled. "That can be dangerous to a girl of fourteen. Or a woman of forty, for that matter." -- Garth Nix

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "When the dead do walk seek water's run, for this the Dead will always shun. Swift river's best or broadest lake to ward the dead and have and make. If water fails thee, fire's thy friend, if neither guards it will be thy end." -- Garth Nix

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "The visions are fragmented and a dark cloud spreads like spilt ink across the pages of possible futures." -- Garth Nix

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Maybe if I act well enough, I'll come to believe it myself." -- Garth Nix

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Euripides
item.description: "Question everything. Learn something. Answer nothing." -- Euripides

item.title: leeanna add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "Deadlines just aren't real to me until I'm staring one in the face." -- Rick Riordan

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Rick Riordan
leeanna add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "You might as well ask an artist to explain his art, or ask a poet to explain his poem. It defeats the purpose. The meaning is only clear thorough the search." -- Rick Riordan

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am paving hell with energy... I am laying down good intentions which I believe durable as flint." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "[O]ur honeymoon will shine our life long: its beams will only fade over your grave or mine." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "No reflection was to be allowed now, not one glance was to be cast back; not even one forward. Not one thought was to be given either to the past or the future. The first was a page so heavenly sweet, so deadly sad, that to read one line of it would dissolve my courage and break down my energy. The last was an awful blank, something like then world when the deluge was gone by." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "It is always the way of events in this life,...no sooner have you got settled in a pleasant resting place, than a voice calls out to you to rise and move on, for the hour of repose is expired." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Conventionality is not morality. Self-righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Mademoiselle is a fairy," he said, whispering mysteriously." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: leeanna add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: leeanna add a quote by Émile Zola
item.description: "If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud." -- Émile Zola
